question: What sport did Muhammad Ali dominate?
fact: Ali, known as ‘The Greatest,’ won the world heavyweight boxing title three times and was famous for his charisma and activism.

question: Which country did Pelé represent in international football?
fact: Pelé won three FIFA World Cups (1958, 1962, 1970) and scored over 1,000 career goals, making him one of football’s greatest icons.

question: How many Grand Slam singles titles did Serena Williams win?
fact: Serena Williams won 23 Grand Slam singles titles, the most by any player in the Open Era, redefining power tennis.

question: Which sport did Michael Jordan play professionally?
fact: Jordan led the Chicago Bulls to six NBA championships and became a global icon of basketball and excellence.

question: In which event is Usain Bolt a world record holder?
fact: Bolt, the Jamaican sprinter, holds world records in the 100 m (9.58 s) and 200 m (19.19 s), earning the nickname ‘Lightning Bolt.’

question: What barrier did Jackie Robinson break in Major League Baseball?
fact: In 1947, Jackie Robinson became the first African-American to play in Major League Baseball, breaking racial barriers in sports.

question: Which sport is Tiger Woods famous for?
fact: Tiger Woods is one of the most successful golfers in history, with 15 major championship wins and a lasting impact on the sport’s popularity.

question: What sport is Simone Biles known for?
fact: Biles is the most decorated gymnast in history with 30+ Olympic and World Championship medals, known for her power and difficulty.

question: Which famous goal is Diego Maradona known for in the 1986 World Cup?
fact: Maradona’s ‘Hand of God’ and ‘Goal of the Century’ in the 1986 World Cup cemented his status as one of football’s greatest talents.

question: Which country did Haile Gebrselassie represent in long-distance running?
fact: Ethiopian runner Haile Gebrselassie set 27 world records and won two Olympic golds in the 10,000 m, revolutionizing long-distance running.

question: In which sport did Michael Phelps become the most decorated Olympian of all time?
fact: Phelps won 23 Olympic gold medals between 2004 and 2016, making him the most decorated Olympian in history.

question: Which Grand Slam tournament has Roger Federer won the most titles at?
fact: Roger Federer has won Wimbledon a record **eight times**, showcasing his mastery on grass courts and calm precision under pressure.

question: In which year did Lewis Hamilton win his first Formula One World Championship?
fact: Lewis Hamilton won his **first Formula One title in 2008** with McLaren, becoming the youngest World Champion at the time.

question: Ronda Rousey became famous for her achievements in which sport?
fact: Rousey was the first female fighter signed by the UFC and the first women’s bantamweight champion, pioneering women’s MMA.

question: Which extreme sport is Tony Hawk most famous for?
fact: Tony Hawk is a skateboarding legend known for being the first to land a 900° spin and for popularizing the sport globally.

question: Valentina Vezzali is a multiple Olympic gold medalist in which sport?
fact: Vezzali, from Italy, is one of the most successful fencers ever, with six Olympic gold medals in foil events.

question: Wayne Gretzky is considered ‘The Great One’ in which sport?
fact: Wayne Gretzky is the NHL’s all-time leading scorer and one of the greatest athletes in Canadian history.

question: Which Olympic Games did Yuna Kim win her gold medal in figure skating?
fact: Yuna Kim won **gold at the 2010 Vancouver Olympics**, setting world-record scores and captivating audiences with her grace and precision.

question: Cristiano Ronaldo became the all-time top scorer in which major European competition?
fact: Ronaldo is the all-time leading scorer in the UEFA Champions League, with over 140 goals, showing unmatched consistency in Europe.

question: Which country did Lionel Messi help win the FIFA World Cup in 2022?
fact: Messi led **Argentina** to victory in the 2022 World Cup, cementing his legacy as one of football’s all-time greats.

question: In which year did Lionel Messi win his first Ballon d’Or award?
fact: Messi won his first Ballon d’Or in 2009 after an incredible season with Barcelona, beginning his record-breaking run of wins.

question: In which World Cup did Zinedine Zidane score twice in the final to help France win?
fact: Zidane scored **two headers in the 1998 World Cup Final**, leading France to its first-ever world title on home soil.

question: Which African country did Didier Drogba famously captain in international football?
fact: Drogba captained the **Ivory Coast national team** and was known for using his influence to help end civil conflict in his country.

question: Megan Rapinoe won the 2019 FIFA Women’s World Cup with which national team?
fact: Rapinoe won the **Golden Boot and Golden Ball** at the 2019 Women’s World Cup, leading the USA to their fourth world title.

question: At what age did Mike Tyson become the youngest heavyweight champion in boxing history?
fact: Mike Tyson became the **youngest heavyweight champion** at just **20 years old** in 1986 after defeating Trevor Berbick.

question: Sugar Ray Robinson was best known for his dominance in which two weight divisions?
fact: Sugar Ray Robinson was considered one of the greatest pound-for-pound fighters ever, dominating the **Welterweight and Middleweight** divisions.

question: Joe Frazier is best remembered for his trilogy of fights with which legendary opponent?
fact: Frazier’s fights with **Muhammad Ali**, especially the *‘Fight of the Century’* in 1971, are some of boxing’s greatest moments.

question: What record does Floyd Mayweather Jr. hold at the end of his professional boxing career?
fact: Mayweather retired with an **undefeated record of 50-0**, becoming one of the most successful defensive boxers in history.
